{"step_by_step_thinking": "gd T cells are a type of T cells that are not MHC restricted and can recognize and respond to certain types of antigens directly. They are not associated with CD4 or CD8, which are markers for helper and cytotoxic T cells respectively. CD5 is a marker for B cells and T cells, but it is not specifically associated with gd T cells. The first line of defense against bacterial peptides is typically the innate immune system, not gd T cells specifically.", "answer_choice": "D"}
